name: FHC-ITP-034 - Cement Treated Crushed Rock Sub-base Rev0
template name: FHC-ITP-034 - Cement Treated Crushed Rock Sub-base Rev0

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall supply all materials required to construct the cementitious treated pavement subbase.
• The supply of Cementitious Treated Crushed Rock or Cementitious Treated Crushed Concrete shall comply with the requirements of Section 815.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Material certificate from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall carry out UCS testing in accordance with the test frequency specified in Table 815.141.

• The UCS during production shall be assessed on a ‘rolling average’ basis where the average of the most recent three UCS test results shall not be less than the minimum value specified in Table 815.101. For the purposes of UCS testing, one representative sample of fully mixed cement treated material shall be taken either from the plant or at the point of delivery in accordance with AS 5101.2.2
2.1 The area has been inspected and Proof rolled by MRPA and consent has been given to proceed with placement of sub-base).
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sub-grade has been inspected, No visible deformation or springing in presence of Superintendent's Rep. Test rolling Plant to comply with requirements of Cl 173.03.
• Where any groundwater is encountered the Superintendents representative must be notified.
• Ensure that test results for underlying lot are available prior to placing sub-base material
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
Maximum allowable working time and moisture content
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The cementitious treated subbase material shall be placed, trimmed to level and fully compacted within the maximum allowable working time specified in Table 306.091.
• The moisture content of the material at the time of spreading and compaction shall not differ from the Modified optimum moisture content, by less than 0.5% and not more than 1.0% by mass.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: a) material shall be spread in such a manner as to minimise the number of joints;
(c) transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2 m;
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
FREQUENCY: Every Lot, Every second lot (reduced frequency)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Minimum MDR of 96% using Modified compaction effort. 3 lot test (Scale B).
• LOT SIZE = Lesser of 4000sqm or a days production is defined as a Lot.
• Every Lot to be tested for surface levels and density ratio using modified compactive effort
• Compaction Testing of every lot shall continue until three consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the   requirement and then resort to one test per 2 lots .
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.4 Level Checking and Conformity with Drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Sub-base shall be constructed to the compacted thickness, levels, lines and grades shown on the drawings
• Layer to be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and after compaction shall conform within the following limits:
• Shape: no point deviation > 8mm from 3m straight edge in any direction
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: No visible deformation or springing in presence of Superintendent's Rep.( Cl 173) Plant to comply with requirements of Cl 173.03.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
2.4 Curing and Protection of Compacted Layers

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The minimum compacted thickness shall be not less than 100 mm and the maximum compacted thickness shall be no more than 180 mm and constructed within the tolerances specified in Clause 306.03.
(a) Pavement Design Modulus of 500 MPa or where no Pavement Design Modulus is Specified:
• The surface of each compacted layer shall be kept moist for a period of seven days unless covered at an earlier stage with the succeeding layer or with an approved curing membrane.
• Construction or other traffic shall not use a compacted layer within 24 hours of placement without the approval of the Superintendent.
• The subbase shall be kept in good order and condition and free from contamination.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: FH shall make delivery dockets available for inspection on request
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
